TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and residing in LOC . She is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and PERSON PERSON PERSON , lawyers practising respectively in GPE , GPE and GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant gave birth to a son Yevgeniy . The applicant and the father of the son lived together from DATE to DATE but were never married . The applicant suffered physical abuse by her partner which led to their separation in DATE . It was agreed that the applicant would have custody of the child and that the child would visit his father at DATE .

In DATE the applicant began to associate with the religious minority known as the Jehovah ’s Witnesses and involved her son in its religious activities . Her former partner , being an NORP believer , turned to a public organisation called ORG and ORG , a ORG agency , with a view to obtaining custody of the child for himself .

On DATE the father refused to return the child to the applicant following a weekend visit . The applicant complained to the police and on DATE filed an application for legal custody with ORG ( Люберецкий городской суд ) . On DATE the applicant was notified that her former partner had already applied for custody and that the hearing of the case was scheduled to begin on DATE .

By judgment of DATE ORG granted custody of the child to the father , ordered him not to prevent the applicant ’s contacts with the child and dismissed the applicant ’s counterclaim . In reaching its decision ORG took into account , inter alia , a report submitted by ORG and prepared by the researchers of ORG , which described the GPE ’s Witnesses organisation as a destructive and totalitarian sect whose activity presents a serious danger for society . It found that the applicant ’s affiliation with the organisation had a harmful effect on the health and development of the child .

On DATE the ORG of ORG ( судебная коллегия по гражданским делам GPE областного суда ) upheld the judgment of the first instance court and dismissed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation . On DATE the applicant requested the Chairman of ORG to order a review of her case . By letter of DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request .

On DATE the applicant filed an application with ORG of Moscow ( ORG районный суд г. PERSON ) - a court with jurisdiction over the father ’s area of residence - to define and extend the contacts with her son , whom she saw TIME a week in the presence of the father . On DATE ORG refused the applicant ’s request to reconsider her case .

On DATE the applicant filed a petition with ORG of GPE requesting its officials to lodge a protest against the lower courts’ judgments . The request was granted by the Deputy Chairman of ORG , whose protest was then put before ORG for consideration . By decision of DATE the ORG of ORG rejected the protest brought by the Deputy Chairman of ORG and upheld the validity of the impugned judgments . The applicant was not present at the hearing before ORG as she was only notified of it on DATE by a letter postmarked CARDINAL June DATE .

By decision of DATE ORG of ORG of GPE revoked , upon a protest by the Deputy Chairman of ORG , the judgments of ORG and ORG , as well as the decision of the Presidium of ORG . It sent the case back to the first instance court for new consideration . It found that in examining the applicant ’s case the courts had infringed norms of substantive and procedural law . In particular , they had wrongly entered into a discussion of the nature of the GPE ’s Witnesses organisation and failed adequately to examine all the relevant individual circumstances of the applicant ’s case .

On DATE , following the re - opening of the custody proceedings , the case went back to ORG , which adjourned it until DATE . As the father failed to appear before the court on that date , the hearing was further postponed until DATE . On DATE ORG , where the applicant ’s request for defined and extended contact stood adjourned , ordered the case to be remitted to ORG for examination jointly with the custody issue .

On DATE ORG held a hearing in which it refused the applicant ’s request for the return of the child pending determination of the long term future as well as for an independent psychological report on his current condition . The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned due to the absence of the father . On DATE ORG held a further hearing .

On DATE the applicant and the father concluded a friendly settlement , renouncing fully their reciprocal claims before ORG concerning the custody of their child . The applicant also withdrew her claims previously presented to the ORG regarding the definition and extension of contacts with her son .

According to the settlement , the child would reside with his father and the mother would have the child at DATE . In agreement with the father , the mother can meet with the child in TIME on DATE and take him with her on school holidays . It was further agreed that the child could not be drawn into religious associations against his will and without the consent of his parents .
By an order issued on DATE , ORG approved the settlement and terminated the proceedings .
